thread.title: Brothel employee recounts finding Lamar Odom unresponsive
thread.title_full: Brothel employee recounts finding Lamar Odom unresponsive

title: Brothel employee recounts finding Lamar Odom unresponsive
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Brothel employee recounts finding Lamar Odom unresponsive The dramatic events surrounding Lamar Odom's collapse at a Nevada brothel were regaled in detail by a first-hand witness on Saturday. Post to Facebook Brothel employee recounts finding Lamar Odom unresponsive The dramatic events surrounding Lamar Odom's collapse at a Nevada brothel were regaled in detail by a first-hand witness on Saturday.  //on.11alive.com/1LGnbIg   Join the Conversation To   Brothel employee recounts finding Lamar Odom unresponsive Richard Hunter of the Love Ranch spoke about finding former NBA star Lamar Odom in his room at the Nevada brothel. USA TODAY Sports USA Today Network Martin Rogers, USA TODAY Sports 11:54 a.m. EDT October 19, 2015 Love Ranch 25 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
LAS VEGAS â€” The dramatic events surrounding Lamar Odom's collapse at a Nevada brothel were regaled in detail by a first-hand witness on Saturday. 
Richard Hunter, media director for the Love Ranch in Crystal, Nev., told HoopsHype.com, a member of the USA TODAY Sports network, how he found Odom in a perilous condition in a suite at the Love Ranch on Tuesday. A female brothel employee had called for help upon finding the former NBA player unresponsive. Lamar Odom has opened eyes and is able to communicate while in hospital 
"I throw that door open and he's on the bed on his back," Hunter said. "Even before I get to the bed, just coming through the doorway, obviously I know something was terribly wrong because this girl was hysterical. 
"I hear him snoring louder than I've heard anybody snore in my life. It didn't even sound like a snore. It sounded like a train going by or something so I knew that was a bad sign. 
"When I jumped up on the bed and I looked at his face he had white foam coming out of his mouth, blood coming out of his nose, some yellow mucusy stuff running down the side of his face." 
Hunter, who was one of two Love Ranch employees to speak with 911, said Odom's condition had some similarities to the infamous scene in the Quentin Tarantino film Pulp Fiction, where a character played by Uma Thurman suffered a drug overdose. Signs for Dennis Hof's Love Ranch Las Vegas brothel are shown on October 14, 2015 in Crystal, Nevada. Former NBA player Lamar Odom was found unconscious during a visit at the brothel and has been hospitalized at Sunrise Hospital & Medical Center in Las Vegas.
